newsitem.title: USA: Sled Dogs in need of short-term financing.
newsitem.headline: Sled Dogs in need of short-term financing.

text.p: Sled Dogs Co said Tuesday the company needs additional short-term financing to fund operations for the 1997-1998 winter season.

Sled Dogs said its board of directors named Kent Rodriguez to the newly created position of chairman. The company said Rodriquez has experience in commercial and investment banking, and will be focusing on the preparation of short- and long-term budgets and the placement of additional financing for the company.

"Additional short-term financing is currently required to support operations and to fund operations for the 97-98 winter season," Sled Dogs said in a release. "(B)usiness will be materially adversely affected if it is unable to secure short-term financing in the near future."

Earlier, Sled Dogs, which provides snow skates and related accessories, reported a net loss for the fiscal second quarter ended December 31 of $1.25 million or $0.09 a share versus $808,145 or $0.09 the previous year.
Sales for the quarter rose to $1.33 million from $504,866.
Sled Dogs said the increase in the net loss is primarily the result of increased media and selling expenses related to promoting the sport of snow skating and the Sled Dogs brand.

"While we're encouraged by the sales growth we've achieved so far this year, the company currently requires additional capital to support operations and continue our sport development and brand building initiatives," John Sundet, president and chief executive, said in a statement.
